title: Relates to leaving the scene of an incident causing personal injury to another person without reporting
summary: Allows prosecutors to prosecute any person operating a motor vehicle who causes personal injury to another person who fail to report such incident.

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to leaving  the
         scene of an incident causing personal injury to another person without
         reporting

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph a of subdivision 2 of section 600 of the  vehicle
    2  and  traffic  law,  as  amended  by  chapter  49 of the laws of 2005, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    a. Any person operating a motor vehicle who, [knowing or having  cause
    5  to  know that personal injury has been caused to another person,] due to
    6  an incident involving the motor vehicle operated by such person,  CAUSED
    7  PERSONAL  INJURY TO ANOTHER PERSON shall, before leaving the place where
    8  the said personal injury occurred, stop, exhibit his or her license  and
    9  insurance  identification  card  for  such  vehicle,  when  such card is
   10  required pursuant to articles six and eight of this  chapter,  and  give
   11  his  or  her name, residence, including street and street number, insur-
   12  ance carrier and insurance identification information including but  not
   13  limited to the number and effective dates of said individual's insurance
   14  policy  and license number, to the injured party, if practical, and also
   15  to a police officer, or in the event that no police officer  is  in  the
   16  vicinity  of the place of said injury, then, he or she shall report said
   17  incident as soon as physically able to the  nearest  police  station  or
   18  judicial officer.
   19    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   20  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2191

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to leaving the
scene of an incident causing personal injury to another person without
reporting

PURPOSE:
To remove the knowledge requirement from the vehicle and
traffic law section relating to leaving the scene of an accident,
where personal injury results.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This legislation would amend
vehicle and
traffic law section 600 to remove from paragraph a of subdivision 2
the language "knowing or having cause to know that personal injury
has been caused to another person," inserting "caused personal injury
to another person."

EXISTING LAW:
Section 600 of the vehicle and traffic
law currently
requires that a person have knowledge of having caused personal
injury before imposing certain penalties for leaving the scene of an
accident.

JUSTIFICATION:
The vehicle and traffic law already
requires a driver
to stop at the scene of an accident, whether or not personal injury
has resulted. Operating a vehicle in New York State is a privilege,
not a right; it is reasonable to expect drivers to stop at the scene
of an accident, and to investigate whether the accident has in fact
caused personal injury.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.2634 of 2009-10, Referred to Transportation
S.93   of 2007-08, Passed Senate
S.6577 of 2005-06, Passed Senate

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
The first of November next succeeding the date on
which it shall have become a law.
